original_comment: abstract subject
content: The artist successfully challenges traditional representation, making the piece thought-provoking and visually engaging.

original_comment: A very fine night-time urban image.  It comfortably satisfies the challenge topic, but that's almost irrelevant, given its many other qualities.  Conception, perspective, composition and execution are all first class.  The light on the pipes establishes a strange, artery-like, "living building" feel.  It's a 10 for me.
content: The work is exceptional, deserving a perfect score for its conception, execution, and overall impact.

original_comment: This shot gets better the more you look at it. sometimes its a shame that we have to have an ultimate "loser."
content: While the piece is engaging and thought-provoking, it raises questions about the criteria we use to evaluate artistic merit.

original_comment: VEry good composition and sharpness!
content: The composition and sharpness effectively enhance the visual impact of the artwork.

original_comment: i love the background color it really bring out the red in its neck. additionally i love the blur incorporated in the photo it really gives me the feeling that its such a fleeting moment. one of 2 10's i gave in this challenge. AMAZING job
content: This piece stands out as exceptional, warranting a high rating for its artistic execution and emotional resonance.

original_comment: The idea is good, it does a good job of identifying the title. The subject is not lit properly however, and it detracts from the photo quite a bit. Her entire face and arm are shadowed. I'd like to see this photo with some fill in flash. Don't be afraid to use flash outdoors, it will remove harsh shadows under the eyes, nose, lips and chin in mid day sun. It will also help in situations like this, where the sky is bright, but the subject itself looks as though they are in a shadow.
content: The work would benefit from the use of fill flash to enhance illumination, reduce harsh shadows, and achieve a more balanced composition.

original_comment: A couple of suggestions I would have (if I may..) are try (in photoshop) to lower the saturation of the background a little. It's tad too red. Such lovely fish should stand out a lot more in the photo.
content: Lowering the background saturation could enhance the overall impact of the piece, allowing the fish to stand out more effectively.

original_comment: Why am I hearing the ghosts of the sea calling??? Great shot that meets the challenge 100% in my book. Well done!
content: This piece successfully fulfills its artistic challenge, demonstrating skill and creativity, warranting high praise.

original_comment: Nice enough picture but something bothers me. focus or lighting. Cant be too sure.
content: While the picture is aesthetically pleasing, the unresolved issues with focus and lighting prevent it from achieving its full potential.

original_comment: Fabulous subject and colors, and super composition!
content: Overall, the artwork is successful in its execution, showcasing strong visual appeal and artistic skill.

original_comment: Technicaly, I find the image a bit pink. toning down the warmth on saturation to darken the sky and water would punch out the city lights and fireworks. nice control of focus and depth.
content: The artist demonstrates strong control of focus and depth, contributing positively to the overall effectiveness of the piece.

original_comment: Beautiful colors, nice composition with the butterfly's wings.
content: The artwork successfully combines aesthetic appeal with meaningful content, making it an engaging piece.

original_comment: great shot !

original_comment: Your subjects are rather blurry and your background could be straighter.

original_comment: Nice shot

original_comment: Amazing view, like the way you have shot it with the natural framing

original_comment: sorry miss the point of this one. ~The apple is not the focus and rest not very interesting

original_comment: A crop around the two red engines to eliminate the pallets might've been interesting too. The pallets are a little distracting, but I like the subject a lot.

original_comment: Actually this is a pretty cool perspective with that sharp focus on his eye, which is in turn focussed on you.  He clearly did not succeed in camouflaging himself ;-)

original_comment: Moonlight and reflections are such a good subject to create a mood.

original_comment: Nice concept, but too much foreground

original_comment: Is this Philly?  That looks like William Penn.  This is a really cool photo, but sadly, it's a bit grainy.  I love the composition and crop.  The lights going down the street really lead your eyes too!  Excellent capture, but again... grain.  If you could take this one again on a tripod with 100 ISO set and leave the shutter open much longer, I bet you could get a truly awesome photo from this very spot!  Good luck :)
content: While the photo is visually appealing and well-composed, the graininess limits its impact. A reshoot with improved settings could elevate the quality significantly, making it a truly outstanding piece.

original_comment: The camera is the ultimate toy.  Good use of perspective to frame this one.
content: This piece successfully demonstrates technical skill and an innovative approach to perspective, making it a noteworthy example of contemporary photography.

original_comment: could be much better if the insect was more in focus

original_comment: Gorgeous spot, nice shot of it too! And how nice to have someone to go out and take photos with.

original_comment: superb photo, focus good, composition good, you deserve a ribbon good luck  10

original_comment: Well composed shot with great contrast. Good work!

original_comment: Nice shot and a top 10! Congrats!

original_comment: I just resized my browser so I could scroll the image and crop out the boy from the shot. original_comment: nice shot

original_comment: Cute shot - something on there 'es interested in getting off...

original_comment: The subject is tack-sharp, but the very blurry blades of grass in the foreground are a bit too blurry for me and become distracting. A tighter crop on the right may have helped; that or a slightly smaller aperture to give them a bit more sharpness.
content: A tighter crop on the right or a smaller aperture could enhance the clarity of the grass, improving the artwork's overall effectiveness.

original_comment: Excellent shot

original_comment: A gorgeous shot really quite majestic

original_comment: i really like how the background has become like pencil sketch .. its a great effect and i think the black and white suits it too .. great shot .. :)

original_comment: Wow, That is amazing that you were able to capture 2 rubythroats together and in reasonably good focus at the same time. That is very difficult to do. Good job. (The one on the bottom appears to be an immature male).

original_comment: Not in focus
content: The lack of focus detracts from the overall impact, making it challenging for the audience to engage fully with the work.

original_comment: The fractal noise as fog layer is too obvious for my taste.  Look at any frame of the new Star Wars films and just marvel at how subtle the effects are.  Overall they add to a great illusion (too bad the actors forgot to act, but thats for another critique) but the effects are accomplished by many many very subtle layers, and by using truly organic elements (shooting real fog, real rust, etc) and layering them in there.
content: The reliance on overt digital effects detracts from the overall quality of the piece, overshadowing the potential for a more immersive experience.

original_comment: This is my favorite shot in the challenge.  In fact, I've stayed up late tonight to make sure you won a ribbon!  I've come back to it several times this week, and each time I'm even more impressed.  The slouch is perfect, the lighting is perfect, and so is everything else.  Good work, and congratulations on a wonderful image.
content: This image stands out as exceptional, deserving recognition for its technical execution and emotional resonance.

original_comment: I like this shot but the lack of contrast detracts from it quite a bit.  In my opinion, setting your black level and increasing saturation would have made this shot much more dramatic.

original_comment: A classic shot of the castle at the Magic Kingdom. I like the crowd with the fireworks, but I would clone out the wire. The clouds make for a nice backdrop, adding another dimension to an otherwise 'snapshot' picture
content: Overall, the image is appealing and captures the spirit of the Magic Kingdom, but the presence of the wire diminishes its potential as a polished piece of art.

original_comment: a nice simple composition - the colors seem a bit muted and dark throughout

original_comment: That bird has ATTITUDE! And gorgeous color. The vertical composition really emphasizes that upright tail.

original_comment: Is this a French doughnut? ;-) Good focus and colour.

original_comment: interesting outfit, but overall look is of a snapshot. at least you could have cropped off the person in the background and avoided the white line at left.

original_comment: I usually wear hiking boots for precaution and carry a strong maglite, a mobile and pepper spray (just in case) along with my camera and an open eye for holes in or glass/nails on the floor.
content: The preparedness indicated in the comment enhances the artistic experience by allowing the photographer to navigate challenging environments confidently, thus potentially leading to more authentic and impactful imagery.

original_comment: This is great but where are the camera stats?

original_comment: Very well composed, I assume this is a candid shot but you really captured emotion on the mans face and it makes me want to hear his story. I really enjoy this kind of shot, thanks and good luck in the challenge.

original_comment: LOL they always are the best ones. I learned the hard way to always put the CF card back in the camera as soon as I finished transferring the photos off it. Headed across to Dargaville to take stock car photos, got there (hour travelling) and discovered the card was still on the kitchen table. Did have a tiny spare in the bag ..... it only held 28 photos!!
content: The anecdote is relatable and conveys a light-hearted approach to a common mistake, showcasing the resilience and adaptability of the photographer in making the best of a limited situation.

original_comment: Nice capture and exposure in tricky lighting conditions.

original_comment: Well done, this is a very hard challenge. the beautiful simplistic style of the artist with its depth is hard to imitate.

original_comment: lovely composition

original_comment: I suspect that you may have been graded down by some for the infamous DNMC comment, but I disagree with that assessment - if in fact that was the reason for the 1 - 3 scores.  To me, this photo is a very creative and artistic expression of "desolation" - desolation of the soul.  I like the technical aspects of the image and the lighting.  I also like the positions of the actors in relation to each other.  While I suspect you just captured what was offered on set, I don't think you could do much better if you staged the shot yourself.  I was not able to vote in this challenge because of my trip, but I would have given it a 7 or possibly an 8.  I think it is well done...as do those who took the time to comment.
content: The work is commendable and deserving of a score between 7 and 8, as it demonstrates creativity and artistic expression, despite any external criticisms.

original_comment: The colors, exposure, tones, and composition of elements really feels like a weathered Norman Rockwell's Saturday Evening Post magazine cover. Great eye to have spotted this story. The irony is that the sign behind him says "Play, because you can". There is no mirth in this man's posture. This is a highly emotional piece.
content: This piece is a highly emotional commentary on the human condition, skillfully executed with a strong narrative that resonates with viewers.

original_comment: Using a smaller aperture might have improved this shot by allowing more of the flowers to be in focus.  If you're subject were a single flower (a flower singled out among others or just one lone flower) then a large aperture would help isolate the subject and minimize background and foreground distractions.  However, when shooting a group of flowers (especially seperate flowers in a group) it is better to use a smaller aperture to increase your depth of field to get more of them in focus.
content: The photograph would benefit from a smaller aperture to better capture the entirety of the floral arrangement, creating a more cohesive image.

original_comment: My focus wants to go to the middle child.

original_comment: I think that in order for this photo to be taken to the next level, you'd have to spend a good bit of time thinking about composition.  Really think it through.  Where do you want your viewer's eye to start, where should the focal point be?  Think along the lines of the rule of thirds.  Draw the viewer's eye into the scene, and give it something (at a convenient location in the image) to rest on.  And always allow a bit of movement -- maybe a couple more string things placed a bit in the background completely out of the focal plane just adding a little bit...or think one single string...
content: Improving the composition by incorporating these suggestions could elevate the photograph, making it more compelling and inviting for the audience.

original_comment: this shot is too blurry...could be sharper...Just Kidding!!
content: While the blurriness detracts from technical precision, it can evoke emotional responses and provoke thought, depending on the viewer's perspective.

original_comment: (p.s. I would also try with less sharpening, as the current setting accentuate the fact that the focus is slightly too far out)

original_comment: Nice shot indeed! :)

original_comment: This is a good start to what I consider "product photography". Shiny metal is quite difficult to photograph in studio. Especially spoons. Let me try to critique this from a purely technical studio approach. The composition to me looks not very well thought out. The front edge ofthe spoon is barely visible. I would like to see the entire rim be lit. The business end of the spoon would be better if it were all in focus. I don't mind the handle fading out at all. The tone is good throughout, but the upper right edge is a bit distracting. It looks as though it is the edge of your backdrop.
content: Overall, while the photograph shows promise, it requires improved composition and technical execution to fully realize its potential in product photography.

original_comment: Very artistic!  I like your choice of subject matter and it's a nice composition...maybe a third parsnip would be nice!
content: Overall, the piece is visually appealing, but the addition of a third parsnip could enhance the composition's balance and complexity.

original_comment: Yea for us in Colorado.  Quite frankly, I was very much surprised how high my score stayed in this challenge. Interesting thing is that this was an off the cuff shot to just take a break from a lot of yard work and home remodeling stuff.
content: The artist's surprising high score indicates a strong connection with the audience, suggesting that authenticity and spontaneity resonate well in contemporary art.

original_comment: I enjoyed the minimalism and composure but not the grainy, noisy BG. Why didn't you post your camera settings? You should get some excellent results (DOF/BG) with that f/2.8?
content: While the minimalist approach is effective, the technical execution, particularly in the background, requires improvement to achieve the desired artistic effect.

original_comment: wow, beautiful, this must have taken you forever!  I love it though and looks like the kind of thing I like to do, very nice detail and sharp focus
content: The artwork is aesthetically pleasing and resonates well with viewers who appreciate detailed and focused artistic expressions.

original_comment: Now back to the photo. I'd consider perhaps a closer view capturing the road in more detail in order to heighten the path of lines. If you were to crop the rightside so as to include the pillar on the right as opposed to center. And cropped out the tree on the left which just becomes distracting as it is half cut. This would provide a much stronger focus on the road.
content: The suggested adjustments would strengthen the composition and improve the viewer's engagement with the road as the focal point.

original_comment: Lovely shot, the vigneting frames the subject well
content: Overall, the photograph is aesthetically pleasing and effectively utilizes compositional techniques to engage the viewer.

original_comment: The composition is a little too centered, and you're about one zone shy of true "pop" here, but there's much to like in this image. Good score from me.
content: Overall, the work has redeeming qualities and merits a positive evaluation despite its compositional shortcomings.

original_comment: Great shot of the new bridge... My company is based in Mt Pleasant and I am looking forward to gettng a chance to drive over this in July... 8
content: The photograph effectively conveys the significance of the bridge, earning a positive response for its aesthetic appeal and relevance.

original_comment: very nice sunset pic, composition and lighting is good, it has a oriental feeling to it, with that roof on pillars, nice work.
content: Overall, the piece is a commendable work that successfully captures the beauty of a sunset while incorporating an intriguing cultural element.

original_comment: I feel it is a nice shot except for the yellow cast. Looks like the whole thing is yellow. Teeth usually have a yellow tint that can be touched up in PS.
content: While the photograph has potential and captures a nice moment, the yellow cast undermines its effectiveness and could benefit from digital correction.

original_comment: A beautiful model. The tones in the background tie in so nicely with his hair and eyes.
content: The artwork is successful in its use of color harmony, contributing to its beauty and appeal.

original_comment: Awesome shot
content: Overall, the piece is impressive and effectively engages the audience with its technical skill and emotional resonance.

original_comment: Great story to go with the photo.  Getting background info behind the shots has been my favorite part of this challenge.  I like the slight vignette on the photo as well.
content: The combination of the engaging story and the effective use of vignette contributes to a compelling and memorable photographic experience.

original_comment: lovely composition and scale.
content: Overall, the artwork successfully achieves an aesthetically pleasing experience through its thoughtful composition and impressive scale.

original_comment: Priceless.  I just love kid shots.  They make the best models and you can enjoy the photo forever.  Great having the background white (planned or not) because it makes the boys stand out that much more.  Great focus and tones again.  I also like how they are posed.
content: The photograph is highly effective, combining strong composition with emotional resonance, making it a valuable piece.

original_comment: nice shot
content: Overall, the piece is successful in its execution and resonates well with viewers, making it a commendable work.

original_comment: Good composition and nice peaceful colors.  Could even be a bit tighter on the bird I think and keep the feel of this shot.  Lighting looks good and I love the ripples on the water.
content: While the composition is strong, tightening the focus on the bird could enhance the impact of the piece without compromising its tranquil feel.

original_comment: Looks delicious! Nice choice of background color.
content: Overall, the artwork successfully combines aesthetic elements that evoke a sense of delight and satisfaction.

original_comment: I sort of wish the crop was a little tighter around the bat just so we could see more of what was going on. Looks like a neat shot though.
content: Overall, the shot is visually appealing and intriguing, though it could benefit from a more refined composition.

original_comment: nice shot
content: Overall, it is a commendable piece that demonstrates skillful photography.

original_comment: Wow! My favorite shot thus far. Varying sized water drops a definate plus. I like how the smallest drop doesn't align with the 3rd tree trunk. Colors are great.
content: This piece stands out as a favorite due to its engaging composition and effective use of color, successfully captivating the viewer's attention.

original_comment: uninteresting scenery, dull sky, lacks of composition
content: Overall, the piece is ineffective in capturing interest, resulting in a lack of aesthetic appeal.

original_comment: I've seen my share of this bridge. I really like this unique viewpoint. Really nicely shot :) (none voter)
content: The photographer successfully conveys a fresh perspective that enhances the aesthetic appeal of the bridge.

original_comment: The bread's washed out, though, and the jars in the background are a little too blurry.  Try narrowing your aperture a bit - it'll help with both problems
content: Adjusting the aperture could enhance the visual clarity and impact of both the bread and the jars, leading to a more effective composition.

original_comment: A nice combination of high-key and soft focus. For my personal taste I would perhaps have preferred her hair to stay in focus - but you know what - it's still a cracking shot.
content: Despite a personal preference for sharper focus on the subject's hair, the overall composition is still considered impressive.

original_comment: The model looks like she wishes to be anywhere else but in front of that lens (no offense to the model). The lightinging has no warmth and is a little to bright. The tacks, which should be the main subject are overpowered by the "you know what" and are out of focus.
content: Overall, the piece suffers from a lack of cohesion and clarity, resulting in a diminished emotional resonance and failure to engage the viewer.

original_comment: Great picture! I love the perspective that you used! Top 5!
content: This artwork is among the top tier due to its compelling perspective and strong visual impact.

original_comment: nice shot but i don't like the light poles coming out of their head
content: While the image is visually appealing, the incorporation of light poles detracts from the overall impact and coherence of the piece.

original_comment: I wonder if a little less depth of focus would have brought out your main subject more, I like the idea behind this image though.
content: The underlying idea of the image is appreciated, but a modification in depth of focus could enhance the clarity and impact of the main subject.

original_comment: a better focal point before taking the shot might have worked better
content: Improving the focal point could significantly elevate the photograph's quality and viewer experience.

original_comment: Overall, great photo.  What caught my attention:  the real shutters on the windows.  I'm nutty that way. I like the overall composition and how you got the sun to cooperate.
content: The photo is successful in engaging the viewer through its composition and effective use of light.

original_comment: good action shot -- the composition really works well in this shot.
content: Overall, the artwork is successful in its execution, demonstrating a strong understanding of composition and its impact on the portrayal of action.

original_comment: Good composition for a narrow frame like this.  The play of light and shadow is interesting too.
content: Overall, the composition and use of light and shadow demonstrate a strong understanding of the medium and effectively captivate the audience.

original_comment: This is an interesting composition, which shows off the architectural detail very well.  You probably had no choice but to crop at this point anyway, but it's effective.  I'd have tried a tiny bit more contrast, to better define the depth of the scene (it seems a little two-dimensional), but maybe you did try that & preferred it this way?  6.
content: Overall, the piece is compelling, but an increase in contrast could enhance its visual impact, leading to a more dynamic representation.

original_comment: I believe your focus is on the swans however I feel this is a shot that would benefit from having everything in focus.
content: The piece could be enhanced by incorporating a deeper depth of field to include more detail in the background.

original_comment: Very pleasing and wonderful color.  The focus is perfectly on the important feature (eyelashes).  Lighting and exposure are perfect.  Wonderful image, Congratulations on a nice work of art!
content: This is a commendable piece of art, showcasing skillful execution and a pleasing aesthetic.

original_comment: Composition: 4, A centered subject is usually the most static.  You might try moving it off to the side and then tilting the image to add energy to the subject.  Also, the twig on the right does nothing to add to the composition, it merely distracts.
content: The current composition lacks vitality and could benefit from a more engaging arrangement.

original_comment: Background has been put out of focus successfully, but is still too distracting. Man's skin tone seems a bit gray. Composition doesn't quite work for me.
content: Overall, the artwork suffers from compositional flaws and color issues that detract from its impact and effectiveness.

original_comment: great tones and perspective here. -9-
content: The artist successfully employs these techniques, resulting in a visually compelling piece.

original_comment: I think this shot would be better without the border. The flower have some parts out of focus and the background is too dark, which is really not cool for bokeh. The left part has almost a good bokeh, but i think you lost a lot with the dark parts.
content: The photograph would benefit from the removal of the border and a lighter background to improve focus and enhance the bokeh effect.

original_comment: neat looking shot here. i love the colors on here, really makes the oldness come out
content: Overall, the piece successfully captures a harmonious blend of aesthetics and emotional resonance.

original_comment: I might have liked a slightly different angle so more of the space between steps could be seen, but I do like the contrast between the stairs and the sky (more than one shot with this contrast this time around).  Since a lot of the railing is showing more of the highlights like in the middle would have been nicer.  Nice shot overall.
content: Overall, the shot is aesthetically pleasing, but a different angle could enhance the composition by providing a more comprehensive view of the staircase's spatial dynamics.

original_comment: great shot I just dont see the leading lines.
content: While the photograph is visually appealing, it could benefit from stronger compositional techniques to enhance viewer engagement.

original_comment: Nice composition
content: The composition is successful and contributes positively to the overall impact of the artwork.

original_comment: I was actually trying to make something which would work as a neutral-density filter. I figured I could focus the camera on the distant subject, and that the dots/lines in the filter would be so OOF that they'd disappear -- there's been a recent discussion of this effect in a thread about shooting animals through cage bars. Obviously, it only partially works.
content: While the piece only partially succeeds in its intended effect, it demonstrates a thoughtful engagement with technical concepts in photography.

original_comment: great shot but why the sephia? would have looked nicer in color.
content: While the composition is strong, the sepia treatment may not be the most effective choice for this particular image, as it could benefit from the richness of color.

original_comment: Impressive! Best bug shot I've seen so far in this challenge. Lovely clarity.
content: This is one of the standout pieces in the challenge, effectively combining technical excellence with aesthetic appeal.

original_comment: I like this shot. good the composition and the light. a bit of overexposition on the right for a better dramatical effect. very good.
content: Overall, the photograph is very good, showcasing strong elements of composition and lighting.

original_comment: Wow, what a brilliant photo. Dam.. If I took that photo I'd freak out though.. that white tent in the background is annoying :P. Though, not everyones a perfectionist. Good work.
content: Overall, the photograph is commendable for its brilliance, despite minor flaws that may not detract from its overall impact.

original_comment: That sky is absolutely gorgeous. I think this was an especially challenging challenge. I believe it fits the challenge well. Overall this shot is good. I like the story I get from it. Not sure how this could be improved, IMO... 8
content: Overall, the artwork is well-executed and meets the challenge effectively, warranting a score of 8.

original_comment: Afraid to say the challenge said no motion trails.  Good shot otherwise.  7
content: Overall, the piece is well-executed and deserving of a score of 7.
